author: noweb
title: Sports - The Times-Tribune
text:
Sign Up Text Alerts | newsletter 
CLIPBOARD 
REGISTRATION — St. Mary’s youth basketball registration for students in grades K-7 will be tonight from 5:30-7:30 p.m. at South Scranton Little League, the Harmon Field Clubhouse, at 400 Meadow Ave. 
■ Holy Rosary basketball will hold final registration Saturday at the Holy Rosary Center from 9 a.m.-noon and Sunday from noon-3 p.m., for all boys and girls in kindergarten through eighth grade. 
YOUTH BASEBALL — The East Coast Sandhogs Travel Baseball Organization will host early bird tryouts for the 2016 season for players ages 7 through 18 for their 8U through 18U teams. Tryouts are $15 per player and will be held at Electric City Baseball & Softball Academy on the following dates: Nov. 14 from 9-11:30 a.m. for ages 7 through 12; 1-3:30 p.m. for ages 13-18; and Dec. 5 from 9-11:30 a.m. for ages 13 through 18, and 1-3:30 p.m. for ages 7-12. Players need to only attend one tryout, but must preregister at www.sandhogsbaseball.com. 
SHOWCASE — Electric City Baseball & Softball Academy will host the third annual NEPA High School Baseball Prospect Showcase on Nov. 7 from 9 a.m.-4:30 p.m. at Riverfront Sports and ECBSA. Over 30 colleges are expected to be represented. Only 100 players will be accepted. Cost: $185, and for information: call 570-955-0471, or download a pamphlet at www.electriccitybaseball.com. We welcome user discussion on our site, under the following guidelines: To comment you must first create a profile and sign-in with a verified DISQUS account or social network ID. Sign up here. Comments in violation of the rules will be denied, and repeat violators will be banned. Please help police the community by flagging offensive comments for our moderators to review.
